TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit EditableStream extends System.IO.Stream
Public MustInherit Class EditableStream Inherits Stream

Docs.summary: The class representing MIP SDK EditableStream that add in place memory operations.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 Delete(int32 count) cil managed
Public MustOverride Function Delete (count As Integer) As Integer

Docs.param: The requested number of bytes to delete
Docs.summary: Deletes up to the specified number of bytes at the current position in the stream; the requested number of bytes may not be deleted. Bytes to the right of the removed bytes will be shifted left.
Docs.returns: The number of bytes actually deleted

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void Insert (byte[] buffer, int offset, int count);

Public MustOverride Sub Insert (buffer As Byte(), offset As Integer, count As Integer)
abstract member Insert : byte[] * int * int -> unit

Docs.param: The buffer to copy bytes from
Offset in the buffer from which to begin copying bytes from
The number of bytes to insert
Docs.summary: Inserts the specified number of bytes at the current position in the stream. Bytes to the right of the current position will be shifted right.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void Update (byte[] buffer, int offset, int count, int replacementCount);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Update(unsigned int8[] buffer, int32 offset, int32 count, int32 replacementCount) cil managed
Public MustOverride Sub Update (buffer As Byte(), offset As Integer, count As Integer, replacementCount As Integer)
abstract member Update : byte[] * int * int * int -> unit

Docs.param: The buffer to insert bytes from
The offset in the buffer to begin copying bytes from
The number of bytes from the buffer to insert
The number of bytes to remove from the stream before insertion
Docs.summary: Replaces a segment in the middle of the stream with provided bytes. Effectively the same as Write except that the number of bytes deleted may not match the number inserted.
